newsitem.title: FINLAND: Skandia ups Pohjola stake - agency.
newsitem.headline: Skandia ups Pohjola stake - agency.

text.p: Swedish insurer Skandia Insurance Co has increased its stake in Finnish insurer Vakuutusosakeyhtio Pohjola by changing about a million B shares for vote-strong A shares, Finnish STT news agency reported on Monday.
The transaction upped Skandia's stake of votes to 7.8 percent from 3.5 percent, the agency said.
Wholesaler Kesko's Tuko had confirmed selling an equivalent amount of A shares, the agency said.
A Pohjola spokesman said he could not confirm the report.

Brokerage Aros Securities earlier traded 1,078,547 vote-strong A shares and 1,079,047 B shares in Pohjola at 101.50 markka (down 2.50) and 99.50 markka (up 0.50) respectively on the Helsinki Stock Exchange.
A Tuko spokesman said it had sold 1,078,147 shares but he declined to give any further details.

A broker at another brokerage earlier said Tuko may have sold its vote-strong but illiquid A shares -- it on September 4 held 1,078,147 A shares -- to one of the other large owners interest in votes rather than liquidity. @
That owner would then have placed an about equivalent amount of liquid B shares with an international investor, he said.
Of Pohjola's large owners, only Suomi and Pohjola's Swedish partner Skandia per September 4 owned as many B shares as were now traded, the official said.
